page.title: 18EDUCATION IN DATCHWORTH
page.content: {All Saints School,}Datchworth was founded in 1820. The land and most of the buildings were given by local people. It is situated in Hollybush Lane to the West of the Church. It is a Voluntary Aided Church of England Primary School. There are now 4 new classrooms. The number on roll in September 1985 was 70.The school has 120 places. The majority of children in the village attend although a few go to private schools. Most children go to Stevenage for {Secondary education}on coaches provided by the L.E.A. There is a private{play group}in the Village Hall catering for 26 3-5 year olds on a part time rota. The fee is Â£1 per morning. Occasional non-vocational evening classes are provided in the village by Stevenage College of F.E.
